text: Sir James Vernon AC CBE FTSE (1910-2000) was an Australian Industrial Chemist who, amongst other things, served as Director of CSR (Colonial Sugar Refining Company) 1958-82.Vernon, James (1910 - 2000), Encyclopaedia of Australian Science. He also served on the boards of a raft of other companies including: Director, Westham Dredging Company Pty Ltd 1975-91; Chairman, CIBC Australia Ltd 1974-89; Chairman, Volvo Australia Pty Ltd 1980-89; Chairman, O'Connell St Associates, and International President of the Pacific Basin Economic Council 1980-82. == Vernon Report == In 1965, Vernon issued a major economic report from "the committee of economic enquiry" regarding Australia's economy. ==Honours and awards== * 1961 Officer of the Order of the British Order (OBE)OBE, 31 December 1960, It's an Honour, Citation: Director of the Colonial Sugar Refiners * 1962 Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE)CBE, 2 June 1962, It's an Honour, Citation: Commerce and industry * 1965 Knight BachelorKtB, 1 January 1965, It's an Honour, Citation: Services to commerce and industry * 1965 Leighton Medal, Royal Australian Chemical Institute * 1976 Foundation Fellow, Australian Academy of Technological Sciences and Engineering * 1980 Companion of the Order of Australia (AC)AC, 26 January 1980, It's an Honour, Citation: For service to industry and to government *John Storey Medal, Australian Institute of Management *Order of Sacred Treasure 1st Class Japan ==References== ==External links== *Burrell, Steve, "Obituary: Sir James Vernon, AC, CBE", The Age, 24 July 2000 *Vernon, James, AC, CBE (1910-2000), trove.nla.gov.au Category:1910 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Australian chemists Category:Companions of the Order of Australia Category:Australian Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:Fellows of the Australian Academy of Technological Sciences and Engineering
